FuncDef:
The ipv6 command configures the load balancing mode for ipv6 packets in a load balancing profile.
The undo ipv6 command deletes the specified load balancing mode or restores the default load balancing mode for ipv6 packets in a load balancing profile. The ipv6 command configures the load balancing mode for ipv6 packets in a load balancing profile. The undo ipv6 command deletes the specified load balancing mode or restores the default load balancing mode for ipv6 packets in a load balancing profile. By default, ipv6 packets are load balanced based on src-ip, dst-ip, l4-src-port, and l4-dst-port. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.
CLIs: ipv6 [ src-ip | dst-ip | protocol | l4-src-port | l4-dst-port ]
undo ipv6 [ src-ip | dst-ip | protocol | l4-src-port | l4-dst-port ]

ParaDef.Info:
Performs load balancing based on the source ipv6 address.
-

Performs load balancing based on the destination ipv6 address.
-

Performs load balancing based on the protocol type.
-

Performs load balancing based on the transport-layer source port number.
-

Performs load balancing based on the transport-layer destination port number.
-

ExtraInfo: The ipv6 command configures the load balancing mode for ipv6 packets in a load balancing profile. The undo ipv6 command with no parameter specified restores the default load balancing mode for ipv6 packets whereas the undo ipv6 command with a parameter specified deletes the specified load balancing mode for ipv6 packets.
